author: Staff Reporter
text:
A couple has donated an acre of their land holdings to construct additional classrooms for Government Higher Secondary School in E. Pudupalayam in Elandakuttai Panchayat in Pallipalayam here on Thursday.

The school was upgraded in 2011. At present, 700 students are pursuing their studies in the school.

Due to lack of space, additional classrooms could not be constructed and students used to take classes sitting under trees.

C. Sugumar, and wife S. Mala decided to donate land so that classrooms could be constructed for the school. At a function held on Thursday, the couple handed over the documents to the Minister for Industries and Transport P. Thangamani.

District Revenue Officer K. Palanisamy was present. The school headmaster said that additional classrooms at a cost of Rs. 1.58 crore would be soon. Likewise, S. Sujatha of Alagapuram in Ward 15 had through a letter expressed her willingness to donate 801.50 sq ft for enabling the corporation to lay road.

The current width of the road is just 3.17 m.
title: Couple donates an acre to construct classrooms
